ok...

but i still have no idea as to what contstitutes a "valid" ->software name,
or a valid -->info-url.

if someone could provide a sample as to what the heritrix app expects, i
could determine what i need to provide.. is the info-url the url that i'm
trying to parse through, is it something else? what is the info-url used
for? the docs don't give a clear answer/understanding to these questions.

i'm missing something...

thanks

-bruce


-----Original Message-----

Sent: Saturday, May 29, 2004 12:11 PM

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix - use...


bruce wrote:

> more information...
>
> the actual error i'm getting is:
>
> 20040529051254496    Simple    Could not launch job - Fatal
> InitializationException     Crawl order   Crawl report   Seeds report
Seed
> file   Logs   Journal   Delete
>  A fatal InitializationException occured when loading job:
> You must set the User-Agent and From HTTP header values to acceptable
> strings.
>  User-Agent: [software-name](+[info-url])[misc]
>  From: [email-address]

The User-Agent field must match the given template, including the
parentheses and '+', with your custom values replacing '[software-name]',
'[info-url]' and (if desired) '[misc]'. The info-url must be a valid
url.

> any ideas as to what i should be using ..
>
> i used >>> os-heritrix/0.8.1 mozilla
>        >>> bedouglas@...
>
> is there a sample of what i should be using, as well as the correct format
> for the input information...

You don't have the parenthesis, '+', or valid URL about your
crawling effort in the User-Agent. Your From value is fine.

- Gordon @ IA
